title: Animal Classification
description: How well can you classify animals into their correct groups?

questions.question: Which of these animals is a mammal?
questions.explanation: Dolphins are mammals. They breathe air, are warm-blooded, give birth to live young, and nurse their babies with milk.

questions.question: Which of these is a reptile?
questions.explanation: Turtles are reptiles. They have scaly skin, are cold-blooded, and lay eggs on land. Frogs, salamanders, and toads are all amphibians.

questions.question: What class of animal is a penguin?
questions.explanation: Penguins are birds (class Aves). Although they cannot fly, they have feathers, lay eggs, and are warm-blooded like all birds.

questions.question: Which of these animals is an amphibian?
questions.explanation: Newts are amphibians. They spend part of their life in water and part on land, and undergo metamorphosis from aquatic larvae to adults.

questions.question: Which of these animals is an insect?
questions.explanation: Ladybugs (ladybirds) are insects with six legs and three body segments. Spiders, scorpions, and ticks are arachnids with eight legs.

questions.question: A whale shark is classified as what type of animal?
questions.explanation: Despite its name and enormous size, a whale shark is indeed a fish — specifically a shark. It is the largest living species of fish.

questions.question: Which of these is a marsupial?
questions.explanation: Koalas are marsupials, meaning they carry and nurse their young in a pouch. They are native to Australia.

questions.question: Which of these is a crustacean?
questions.explanation: Lobsters are crustaceans with a hard exoskeleton, segmented bodies, and jointed limbs. Octopuses are mollusks, clams are bivalves, and jellyfish are cnidarians.

questions.question: The platypus is best classified as what type of mammal?
questions.explanation: The platypus is a monotreme — an egg-laying mammal. Monotremes are the most primitive group of living mammals, found only in Australia and New Guinea.

questions.question: Which of these sea creatures is actually a fish, not a mammal?
questions.explanation: Seahorses are fish. They breathe through gills and live entirely underwater. Porpoises, manatees, and sea lions are all marine mammals.

questions.question: Which of these animals is a cephalopod?
questions.explanation: The nautilus is a cephalopod, related to octopuses and squids. Sea urchins, starfish, and sea cucumbers are all echinoderms.

questions.question: What order do bats belong to?
questions.explanation: Bats belong to the order Chiroptera, meaning 'hand wing.' They are the only mammals capable of true sustained flight.

questions.question: The tuatara of New Zealand is often mistaken for a lizard, but it belongs to which order?
questions.explanation: Tuataras belong to the order Rhynchocephalia (sometimes called Sphenodontia). They are the sole surviving members of this ancient reptile order.

questions.question: Which of these is a cartilaginous fish rather than a bony fish?
questions.explanation: Stingrays are cartilaginous fish (class Chondrichthyes), meaning their skeletons are made of cartilage rather than bone, like sharks and skates.

questions.question: The axolotl is a well-known example of which biological phenomenon?
questions.explanation: Axolotls exhibit neoteny — they retain their juvenile aquatic features (like gills) throughout adulthood without undergoing full metamorphosis into a terrestrial form.
